main event: On 10 March 1949, Cpl. Paul James Hutchinson observed an unidentified flying object near Albuquerque, New Mexico.
interesting points: The object was spherical and yellow in color,It was estimated to be twice the size of an automobile headlight,The object's speed was estimated at 200 MPH with no deviation from its horizontal path,The observation took place at an altitude of 300' to 400',The sighting occurred between 2200 to 2215 hours with clear weather conditions.
witness description: Cpl. Paul James Hutchinson, who had no previous experience as an observer.
